implementation-defined-item.name: expressionUnicode
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba's Unicode version is whatever ICU's Unicode is. Latest ICU supports Unicode 6.0.
implementation-defined-item.description: The version of Unicode that is used to construct expressions.

implementation-defined-item.name: collations
implementation-defined-item.description: The statically-known collations.

implementation-defined-item.name: implicitTimezone
implementation-defined-item.value: The implicit timezone is computed based on the current local time of the computer running Zorba.
implementation-defined-item.description: The implicit timezone.

implementation-defined-item.name: warningsMethod
implementation-defined-item.value: Warnings are handled via instances of the zorba::DiagnosticHandler class. For details, see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/cxx/html/classzorba_1_1DiagnosticHandler.html and http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/xqdoc/xhtml/www.zorba-xquery.com_warnings.html.
implementation-defined-item.description: The circumstances in which warnings are raised, and the ways in which warnings are handled.

implementation-defined-item.name: errorsMethod
implementation-defined-item.value: Errors are handled via instances of the zorba::DiagnosticHandler class. For details, see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/cxx/html/classzorba_1_1DiagnosticHandler.html.
implementation-defined-item.description: The method by which errors are reported to the external processing environment.

implementation-defined-item.name: XMLVersion
implementation-defined-item.value: XML 1.0
implementation-defined-item.description: Whether the implementation is based on the rules of [XML 1.0] and [XML Names] or the rules of [XML 1.1] and [XML Names 1.1]. One of these sets of rules must be applied consistently by all aspects of the implementation.

implementation-defined-item.name: overwrittenContextComponents
implementation-defined-item.value: The following static context components are overwritten/augmented: 1. Statically known namespaces: Augmented with zerr –> http://www.zorba-xquery.com/ 2. Context item static type: item() 3. Default order for empty sequences: empty_greatest 4. Static Base URI: We use the rules in 4.5, where the implementation-defined default mentioned there is http://www.zorba-xquery.com, 5. Statically known default collection type: item()*
implementation-defined-item.description: Any components of the static context or dynamic context that are overwritten or augmented by the implementation.

implementation-defined-item.name: axes
implementation-defined-item.value: All axes are supported.
implementation-defined-item.description: Which of the optional axes are supported by the implementation, if the Full-Axis Feature is not supported.

implementation-defined-item.name: defaultOrderEmpty
implementation-defined-item.description: The default handling of empty sequences returned by an ordering key (sortspec) in an order by clause (empty least or empty greatest).

implementation-defined-item.name: pragmas
implementation-defined-item.value: No pragmas are recognized.
implementation-defined-item.description: The names and semantics of any extension expressions (pragmas) recognized by the implementation.

implementation-defined-item.name: optionDeclarations
implementation-defined-item.value: See http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/html/options_and_annotations.html.
implementation-defined-item.description: The names and semantics of any option declarations recognized by the implementation.

implementation-defined-item.name: externalFunctionProtocols
implementation-defined-item.value: See http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/html/external_functions.html
implementation-defined-item.description: Protocols (if any) by which parameters can be passed to an external function, and the result of the function can returned to the invoking query.

implementation-defined-item.name: moduleLocationHints
implementation-defined-item.value: See http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/html/modules_top.html.
implementation-defined-item.description: The process by which the specific modules to be imported by a module import are identified, if the Module Feature is supported (includes processing of location hints, if any.)

implementation-defined-item.name: staticTypingExtensions
implementation-defined-item.value: Static typing is not supported.
implementation-defined-item.description: Any static typing extensions supported by the implementation, if the Static Typing Feature is supported.

implementation-defined-item.name: serializationInvocation
implementation-defined-item.value: The result of an XQuery program can be serialized via the zorba::XQuery::execute methods (see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/cxx/html/classzorba_1_1XQuery.html). Sequence of items can be serialized via the zorba::Serializer::serialize method (see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/cxx/html/classzorba_1_1Serializer.html).
implementation-defined-item.description: The means by which serialization is invoked, if the Serialization Feature is supported.

implementation-defined-item.name: serializationDefaults
implementation-defined-item.value: Serialization Feature is supported. Implicit values are: byte-order-mark = no, encoding = UTF-8, media-type = '', normalization-form = '', omix-xml-declaration = no, standalone = omit, version = '1.0', method = xml, doctype-system = '', doctype-public = '', cdata-section-elements = empty list, include-content-type = no, undeclare-prefixes = no, indent = no
implementation-defined-item.description: The default values for the byte-order-mark, encoding, media-type, normalization-form, omit-xml-declaration, standalone, and version parameters, if the Serialization Feature is supported.

implementation-defined-item.name: externalFunctionCall
implementation-defined-item.value: An error is raised using the regular error handling mechanism of zorba. The kind of error depends on the kind of failure. For example, zerr:ZXQP0008 if the function implementation is not found, or err:XPTY0004 if the result of the function does not match the declared returned type.
implementation-defined-item.description: The result of an unsuccessful call to an external function (for example, if the function implementation cannot be found or does not return a value of the declared type).

implementation-defined-item.name: limits
implementation-defined-item.value: totalDigits = 2^63, xs:string length = available memory.
implementation-defined-item.description: Limits on ranges of values for various data types, as enumerated in 5.3 Data Model Conformance.

implementation-defined-item.name: traceDestination
implementation-defined-item.value: By default, it is std:cerr. Users can modify this via the StaticContext::setTraceStream method.
implementation-defined-item.description: The destination of the trace output is implementation-defined. See 4 The Trace Function.

implementation-defined-item.name: integerOperations
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba raises [err:FOAR0002]
implementation-defined-item.description: For xs:integer operations, implementations that support limited-precision integer operations must either raise an error [err:FOAR0002] or provide an implementation-defined mechanism that allows users to choose between raising an error and returning a result that is modulo the largest representable integer value. See 6.2 Operators on Numeric Values.

implementation-defined-item.name: decimalDigits
implementation-defined-item.value: On a 32-bit system, the number of digits of precision is 2^31; on a 64-bit system, the number of digits of precision is 2^63.
implementation-defined-item.description: For xs:decimal values the number of digits of precision returned by the numeric operators is implementation-defined. See 6.2 Operators on Numeric Values. See also 17.1.3.3 Casting to xs:decimal and 17.1.3.4 Casting to xs:integer.

implementation-defined-item.name: roundOrTruncate
implementation-defined-item.value: It does whatever the underlying C++ implementation does.
implementation-defined-item.description: If the number of digits in the result exceeds the number of digits that the implementation supports, the result is truncated or rounded in an implementation-defined manner. See 6.2 Operators on Numeric Values. See also 17.1.3.3 Casting to xs:decimal and 17.1.3.4 Casting to xs:integer.

implementation-defined-item.name: Unicode
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba's Unicode version is whatever ICU's Unicode is. Latest ICU supports Unicode 6.0.
implementation-defined-item.description: It is implementation-defined which version of Unicode is supported by the features defined in this specification, but it is recommended that the most recent version of Unicode be used. See 7.1 String Types.

implementation-defined-item.name: normalizationForms
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba supports NFC, NFKC, NFD, NFKD normalization forms.
implementation-defined-item.description: For 7.4.6 fn:normalize-unicode, conforming implementations must support normalization form "NFC" and may support normalization forms "NFD", "NFKC", "NFKD", "FULLY-NORMALIZED". They may also support other normalization forms with implementation-defined semantics.

implementation-defined-item.name: collationUnits
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba does not support this.
implementation-defined-item.description: The ability to decompose strings into collation units suitable for substring matching is an implementation-defined property of a collation. See 7.5 Functions Based on Substring Matching.

implementation-defined-item.name: secondsDigits
implementation-defined-item.value: Year values: Zorba supports 9 digits (32bit maxint). Fractional second: Zorba supports 6 digits.
implementation-defined-item.description: All minimally conforming processors must support year values with a minimum of 4 digits (i.e., YYYY) and a minimum fractional second precision of 1 millisecond or three digits (i.e., s.sss). However, conforming processors may set larger implementation-defined limits on the maximum number of digits they support in these two situations. See 10.1.1 Limits and Precision.

implementation-defined-item.name: stringToDecimal
implementation-defined-item.value: On a 32-bit system, the number of digits of precision is 2^31; on a 64-bit system, the number of digits of precision is 2^63.
implementation-defined-item.description: The result of casting a string to xs:decimal, when the resulting value is not too large or too small but nevertheless has too many decimal digits to be accurately represented, is implementation-defined. See 17.1.1 Casting from xs:string and xs:untypedAtomic.

implementation-defined-item.name: docProcessing
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba provides no configuration options for 15.5.4 fn:doc.
implementation-defined-item.description: Various aspects of the processing provided by 15.5.4 fn:doc are implementation-defined. Implementations may provide external configuration options that allow any aspect of the processing to be controlled by the user.

implementation-defined-item.name: weakenStable
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba provides no options to weaken the stable characteristics of 15.5.6 fn:collection or 15.5.4 fn:doc.
implementation-defined-item.description: The manner in which implementations provide options to weaken the stable characteristic of 15.5.6 fn:collection and 15.5.4 fn:doc are implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: additionalTypes
implementation-defined-item.value: There are no implementation-defined types. User-defined types are created and become “in-scope” when “import schema” statements are processed. User-defined types (including anonymous types) are created within a static context and they are destroyed when their containing static context is destroyed.
implementation-defined-item.description: Support for additional user-defined or implementation-defined types is implementation-defined. (See 2.6.1 Representation of Types)

implementation-defined-item.name: undefinedProperties
implementation-defined-item.description: Some typed values in the data model are undefined. Attempting to access an undefined property is always an error. Behavior in these cases is implementation-defined and the host language is responsible for determining the result. (See 5 Accessors)

implementation-defined-item.name: sequenceNormalization
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba performs sequence normalization for the 'binary' serialization method. Zorba's Data Converters module performs sequence normalization for JSON and JSONML (but these are not serialization output methods, i.e. they cannot be invoked with the help of '-z method=JSON')
implementation-defined-item.description: For any implementation-defined output method, it is implementation-defined whether sequence normalization process takes place. (See 2 Sequence Normalization)

implementation-defined-item.name: outputMethods
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba's only implementation-defined output method is 'binary' and it is used unqualified (URI is null).
implementation-defined-item.description: If the namespace URI is non-null for the method serialization parameter, then the parameter specifies an implementation-defined output method. (See 3 Serialization Parameters)

implementation-defined-item.name: normalizationFormBehavior
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba has no implementation-defined values for the normalization-form parameter.
implementation-defined-item.description: If the value of the normalization-form form parameter is not NFC, NFD, NFKC, NFKD, fully-normalized, or none then the meaning of the value and it's effect is implementation-defined. (See 4 Phases of Serialization)

implementation-defined-item.name: additionalParams
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba has no implementation-defined serialization parameters.
implementation-defined-item.description: The effect of additional serialization parameters on the output of the serializer, where the name of such a parameter must be namespace-qualified, is implementation-defined or implementation-dependent. The extent of this effect on the output must not override the provisions of this specification. (See 3 Serialization Parameters)

implementation-defined-item.name: encodingPhase
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba has no such option.
implementation-defined-item.description: The effect of providing an option that allows the encoding phase to be skipped, so that the result of serialization is a stream of Unicode characters, is implementation-defined. The serializer is not required to support such an option. (See 4 Phases of Serialization)

implementation-defined-item.name: CDATASerialization
implementation-defined-item.value: Input CDATA sections are treated and serialized as text. Text nodes can be serialized as cdata sections if explicitly requested through the cdata-section-elements parameter.
implementation-defined-item.description: An serializer may provide an implementation-defined mechanism to place CDATA sections in the result tree. (See 5.1.4 XML Output Method: the cdata-section-elements Parameter)

implementation-defined-item.name: Tokenization
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba uses ICU for word tokenization, so what ever ICU's rules are are Zorba's rules. ICU uses the 'Unicode Standard Annex #29: Unicode Text Segmentation' rules found here http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr29 .
implementation-defined-item.description: Tokenization, including the definition of the term "tokens", SHOULD be implementation-defined. Implementations SHOULD expose the rules and sample results of tokenization as much as possible to enable users to predict and interpret the results of tokenization.

implementation-defined-item.name: phrase
implementation-defined-item.value: A phrase in nothing more that 1+ tokens separated by text boundaries as defined by http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr29 .
implementation-defined-item.description: A phrase is an ordered sequence of any number of tokens. Beyond that, phrases are implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: sentence
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba uses ICU for sentence tokenization, so what ever ICU's rules are are Zorba's rules. ICU uses the 'Unicode Standard Annex #29: Unicode Text Segmentation' rules found here http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr29 .
implementation-defined-item.description: A sentence is an ordered sequence of any number of tokens. Beyond that, sentences are implementation-defined. An implementation is not required to support sentences.

implementation-defined-item.name: paragraph
implementation-defined-item.value:
Zorba considers XML elements to be paragraph delimiters. For example:

It was the best of times. It wat the worse of times.

is 1 paragraph; however:

That was a bold is 3 paragraphs since Zorba attaches no semantic meaning to any particular XML elements.
implementation-defined-item.description: A paragraph is an ordered sequence of any number of tokens. Beyond that, paragraphs are implementation-defined. An implementation is not required to support paragraphs.

implementation-defined-item.name: Markup Effect Token Boundaries
implementation-defined-item.value: Markup delimits paragraphs and, by implication, sentences and tokens.
implementation-defined-item.description: Implementations are free to provide implementation-defined ways to differentiate between markup's effect on token boundaries during tokenization.

implementation-defined-item.name: Scoring Expressions
implementation-defined-item.value: Score variables are not currently supported.
implementation-defined-item.description: The set of expressions (of form ExprSingle) that can be assigned to a score variable in a let-clause is implementation-defined. The result of passing an expression to the scoring algorithm that it does not support is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Matching
implementation-defined-item.value: Given the tokens: A B C they have to match: A B C exactly; no more, no less.
implementation-defined-item.description: When a sequence of query tokens is considered as a phrase, it matches a sequence of tokens in the tokenized form of the text being searched only if the two sequences correspond in an implementation-defined way.

implementation-defined-item.name: Match Option Order
implementation-defined-item.value: Match options are applied in the following order: Stop Word Option, Stemming Option, Case Option, Diacritics Option, Wildcard Option, Language Option.
implementation-defined-item.description: The match option application order, subject to the stated constraints, is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Language Option Tokenization
implementation-defined-item.value: The Language Option: * Affects tokenization as performed by ICU. * Selects the stemming algorithm to be used.* Selects the default set of stop-words to be used. The Language Option does not affect any other Match Option.
implementation-defined-item.description: The "language" option influences tokenization, stemming, and stop words in an implementation-defined way. It MAY influence the behavior of other match options in an implementation-defined way.

implementation-defined-item.name: Language Option Valid ID
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba recognizes the ISO 639-1 and 639-2 language identifiers for the following languages: Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, German, Hungarian, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish.
implementation-defined-item.description: The set of valid language identifiers is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Language Option Undefined
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba raises err::XPTY0004 for a string that can not be cast to xs:language and err::FTST0009 for an unsupported language.
implementation-defined-item.description: If an invalid language identifier is specified, then the behavior is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Mismatched Languages
implementation-defined-item.value: xml:lang always wins.
implementation-defined-item.description: When a processor evaluates text in a document that is governed by an xml:lang attribute and the portion of the full-text query doing that evaluation contains an FTLanguageOption that specifies a different language from the language specified by the governing xml:lang attribute, the language-related behavior of that full-text query is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Thesaurus Option
implementation-defined-item.value: This is covered in the Zorba Full Text Thesaurus documentation, http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/html/ft_thesaurus.html
implementation-defined-item.description: It is implementation-defined which thesaurus relationships an implementation supports.

implementation-defined-item.name: Thesaurus Relationships
implementation-defined-item.value: Unsupported thesaurus relationships are treated as no relationship. All levels are supported. When no relationship is specified, all related words are returned.
implementation-defined-item.description: If a query specifies thesaurus relationships or levels not supported by the thesaurus, or does not specify a relationship, the behavior is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Thesaurus Levels
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba uses 2 levels by default.
implementation-defined-item.description: If a query does not specify the number of levels, and the implementation does not follow the default of querying all levels of hierarchical relationships, then the number of levels of hierarchical relationships queries is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Stemming Option
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba uses the publicly available Snowball stemmers found here http://snowball.tartarus.org.
implementation-defined-item.description: It is implementation-defined what a stem of a token is and whether stemming will based on an algorithm, dictionary, or mixed approach.

implementation-defined-item.name: Query Token In Stopword List
implementation-defined-item.value: The query token is compared (case insensitively) against the list of stop words for an exact match.
implementation-defined-item.description: An implementation-defined comparison is used to determine whether a query token appears in the collection of stop words defined by the applicable stop word option.

implementation-defined-item.name: StopWord Option Match Number
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba has no such conditions.
implementation-defined-item.description: Normally a stop word matches exactly one token, but there may be implementation-defined conditions, under which a stop word may match a different number of tokens.

implementation-defined-item.name: StopWord Option Default
implementation-defined-item.value: For each of the supported languages, Zorba defines a set of default stop-words (too big to be listed here).
implementation-defined-item.description: The "stop words default" option specifies that an implementation-defined collection of stop words is used.

implementation-defined-item.name: Extension Option
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba implements no extension options.
implementation-defined-item.description: An implementation recognizes an implementation-defined set of namespace URIs used to denote extension options. The effect of each, including its error behavior, is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Extension Selection
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba implements no extension pragmas.
implementation-defined-item.description: An implementation recognizes an implementation-defined set of namespace URIs used to denote extension selection pragmas. The effect of each, including its error behavior, is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: Equal Items Different Tokens
implementation-defined-item.value: If items are equal, the tokens will also be equal.
implementation-defined-item.description: The conditions under which tokenization of two equal items produces different tokens is implementation-defined.

implementation-defined-item.name: FTIgnoreOption
implementation-defined-item.value: Zorba imposes no restriction; however, the FTIgnoreOption implementation is incomplete.
implementation-defined-item.description: An implementation may impose an implementation-defined restriction on the operand of FTIgnoreOption.

implementation-defined-item.name: Static Context Items
implementation-defined-item.value: FTThesaurusOption has no default value. FTLanguageOption is set to whatever the host's language is. Statically known languages: The ISO 639-1 codes are: da, de, en, es, fi, hu, it, nl, no, pt, sv, ru.
implementation-defined-item.description: For certain full-text components of the static context (see C Static Context Components), the default initial value of the component can be overwritten or augmented with an implementation-defined value or values.

context-property.name: Statically known namespaces
context-property.value: fn –> http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions, xml –> http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace, xs –> http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema, xsi –> http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance, local –> http://www.w3.org/2005/xquery-local-functions, zerr –> http://www.zorba-xquery.com/

context-property.name: Default function namespace
context-property.value: http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions .

context-property.name: In-scope schema types
context-property.value: Built-in types in xs.

context-property.name: Function signatures
context-property.value: Functions in fn namespace, and constructors for built-in atomic types.

context-property.name: Statically known collations
context-property.value: Initially, the only available collation is the codepoint collection: http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/collation/codepoint. More collations can be added to a static context via the StaticContext::addCollation() method of the C++ API.

context-property.name: Default order for empty sequences
context-property.value: empty greatest

context-property.name: Copy-namespaces mode
context-property.value: inherit preserve

context-property.name: Base URI
context-property.value: Uses the rules in http://www.w3.org/TR/xquery-30/#id-base-uri-decl, where the implementation-defined default mentioned there is http://www.zorba-xquery.com

context-property.name: Context item
context-property.value: None. Before execution of a query, a value can be assigned to the context item via the DynamicContext::setContextItem method.

context-property.name: Function implementations
context-property.value: Functions in fn namespace, and constructors for built-in atomic types.

context-property.name: Current dateTime
context-property.value: The current local time on the computer running Zorba.

context-property.name: Implicit timezone
context-property.value: Computed based on the current local time on the computer running Zorba.

context-property.name: Available documents
context-property.value: The URIs returned by the availale-documents function of module http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/store/dynamic/documents (see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/xqdoc/xhtml/www.zorba-xquery.com_modules_store_dynamic_documents.html)

context-property.name: Available collections
context-property.value: The URIs returned by the availale-collections function of module http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/store/dynamic/collections/w3c/ddl (see http://www.zorba-xquery.com/site2/doc/latest/zorba/xqdoc/xhtml/www.zorba-xquery.com_modules_store_dynamic_collections_w3c_ddl.html)

context-property.name: FTCaseOption
context-property.value: case insensitive

context-property.name: FTDiacriticsOption
context-property.value: diacritics insensitive

context-property.name: FTStemOption
context-property.value: no stemming

context-property.name: FTStopWordOption
context-property.value: no stop words

context-property.name: Statically known stop word lists
context-property.value: Zorba uses the publicly available lists found here http://snowball.tartarus.org.

context-property.name: FTLanguageOption
context-property.value: Whatever the host's language is.

context-property.name: Statically known languages
context-property.value: The ISO 639-1 codes are: da, de, en, es, fi, hu, it, nl, no, pt, sv, ru.

context-property.name: FTWildcardOption
context-property.value: no wildcards
